thread.title: In wake of Oregon shooting, father of slain reporter Alison Parker pens emotional column - Nation
thread.title_full: In wake of Oregon shooting, father of slain reporter Alison Parker pens emotional column - Nation

author: boston.com
title: In wake of Oregon shooting, father of slain reporter Alison Parker pens emotional column - Nation
text:
Andy Parker vowed to dedicate his life to gun control after his daughter, Virginia reporter Alison Parker, was shot and killed during a live broadcast. After the mass shooting in Oregon, he’s once again speaking out, writing a column for the NY Daily News .
The emotional column reads as a letter begging legislators to react and work toward gun legislation to help prevent gun violence. Here are three impactful Quote: s that capture Parker’s frustration and despair over gun violence in this country.
Parker opened the column by calling on Republican lawmakers, who he said refuse to act.
 Shame on them for being the cowards that they are. Is the support of a fringe element of the NRA so important that they are willing to accept our children as collateral damage? We are at war in this country, and we must win – whatever it takes.
Parker’s daughter was killed on August 25, a little over a month ago. In the column, he said Alison’s shooter, who was a former coworker, should not have had access to a gun because there were numerous red flags.
When I heard about this shooting in Oregon, I thought, this can’t be. Not this soon. I knew it would happen again. We are a country with a strong gun culture. But I wasn’t expecting it to be this soon.
He likened the issue of gun violence to a cancer.
We need to try different things. It’s like treating cancer. You don’t have just one type of therapy to treat cancer. You have to take several steps. And if this isn’t a cancer in this country, I don’t know what it is.
The entire column is really powerful and definitely worth your time. Give it a read at the Daily News .
